metadata.title: CVE-2022-21123 on Ubuntu 24.04 LTS. (noble) - medium
metadata.description:
Incomplete cleanup of multi-core shared buffers for some Intel(R)Processors may allow an authenticated user to potentially enableinformation disclosure via local access.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-21123` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

intel-microcode - 3.20220510.0ubuntu1
No subscription required

linux-image-6.5.0-9-generic - 5.19.0-15.15
linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-9-generic - 5.19.0-15.15
linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-9-generic-64k - 5.19.0-15.15
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-1008-aws - 5.19.0-1005.5
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-1007-azure - 5.19.0-1004.4
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-1007-gcp - 5.19.0-1004.4
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-1009-ibm - 5.19.0-1004.4
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-9-lowlatency - 5.19.0-1003.3
linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-9-lowlatency-64k - 5.19.0-1003.3
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-1010-oracle - 5.19.0-1004.4
No subscription required

criterions.comment: intel-microcode package in noble was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '3.20220510.0ubuntu1').
linux package in noble, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '5.19.0-15.15').
linux-aws package in noble, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '5.19.0-1005.5').
linux-azure package in noble, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '5.19.0-1004.4').
linux-gcp package in noble, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '5.19.0-1004.4').
linux-ibm package in noble, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '5.19.0-1004.4').
linux-lowlatency package in noble, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '5.19.0-1003.3').
linux-oracle package in noble, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '5.19.0-1004.4').
